article.headline: No new indoor activities in NYC in phase 4, Cuomo says
article.body: Museums, indoor cultural venues, malls and indoor dining will remain closed when New York City is cleared to enter Phase 4, which could begin as soon as Monday, Gov. Andrew Cuomo said on Thursday. The state will make a final decision on whether the city will enter the fourth and final phase of reopening by 4 p.m. Friday, but either way no new indoor activities will open as part of the phase, Cuomo said. --- Beckie Strum
